  <title>Groupoid Methods in Wavelet Analysis</title>
  <creator role="author">
    <personname>Marius Ionescu</personname>
  </creator>
  <creator before=" and " role="author">
    <personname>Paul S. Muhly</personname>
    <contact role="address">6188 Kemeny Hall, Dartmouth College Hanover, NH 03755-3551 </contact>
    <contact role="current_address">438 Malott Hall, Cornell University, Ithaca, NY, 14853</contact>

    <contact role="address">The University of Iowa, Iowa City, IA 52242-1419</contact>
    <contact role="email">pmuhly@math.uiowa.edu</contact>
    <contact role="dedicatory">Dedicated to the memory of George W. Mackey</contact>
  </creator>
  <date name="Date:" role="creation">November 30, 2018</date>
  <abstract name="Abstract.">
    <p>We describe how the Deaconu-Renault groupoid may be used in the study
of wavelets and fractals.</p>
  </abstract>
  <keywords name="Key words and phrases">groupoids, wavelets, fractals, <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="m1">
      <XMath>
        <XMApp>
          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
        </XMApp>
      </XMath>
    </Math>-algebras, Cuntz relations</keywords>
  <classification name="2000 Mathematics Subject Classification" scheme="2000 Mathematics Subject Classification">Primary 22A22, 42C40, 28A80, 46L89, 46L08, 46L55, 46L40; Secondary 58H99, 37F99, 32H50</classification>

DMS-0355443.</acknowledgements>
<!--  %**** String Line 50 **** 
     %**** String Line 75 ****-->  <section inlist="toc" xml:id="S1">
    <tags>

    <title><tag close=". ">1</tag>Introduction</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">1</tag>Introduction</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S1.p1">
      <p>This note serves two purposes. First, we want to describe investigations
that we are undertaking which are inspired in large part by work of
Palle Jorgensen and his collaborators, particularly Ola Bratteli,
Dorin Dutkay and Steen Pedersen<note mark="1" role="footnote" xml:id="footnote1"><tags>
            <tag>1</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">footnote 1</tag>
          </tags>A number of relevant papers are cited in the references to this paper,
but for a more comprehensive list, the reader should consult the books
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BJ02" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> and <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="pJ06" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.</note>. In their papers one finds a rich theory of wavelets on the one hand
and topics in fractal analysis on the other. Further, the analysis
in these papers is laced with representations of the Cuntz relations
- finite families of isometries <Math mode="inline" tex="\{S_{i}\}_{i=1}^{n}" text="((set@(S _ i)) _ (i = 1)) ^ n" xml:id="S1.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.p1.m1.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.p1.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> such that
<Math mode="inline" tex="\sum_{i=1}^{n}S_{i}S_{i}^{*}=1" text="((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@(S _ i * (S _ i) ^ *) = 1" xml:id="S1.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Very roughly speaking, these authors
show that much of the analysis of wavelets and fractals that has appeared
in recent years may be illuminated in terms of special representations
of the Cuntz relations. Indeed, some of the most important advances
are made by choosing an appropriate representation for these relations.
Our motivation was to understand the extent to which the use of the
Cuntz relations is <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">intrinsic</text> to the situation under consideration.
We wanted to separate intrinsically occurring representations of the
Cuntz relations from those that are imposed by special choices. We
<!--  %**** String Line 100 **** -->hoped, thereby, to clarify the degrees of freedom that go into the
representations found in the work we are discussing.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p2">
      <p>As it turns out, the Cuntz isometries that arise in the work of Jorgensen
et. al. may be expressed in terms of representations of the Deaconu-Renault
groupoid associated to an appropriate local homemorphism of a compact
Hausdorff space. Our second purpose is to show how the <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S1.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebra
of this groupoid is related to a number of other <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S1.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebras
that one can attach to a local homeomorphism. In particular, we show
that the <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S1.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebra may be realized as a Cuntz-Pimsner algebra
in two different ways and that, in general, it is a quotient of certain
other <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S1.p2.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebras that one may build from the local homeomorphism.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p3">
      <p>Recall that a wavelet is usually understood to be a vector <Math mode="inline" tex="\psi" text="psi" xml:id="S1.p3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
in <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\mathbb{R})" text="L ^ 2 * R" xml:id="S1.p3.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m2.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p3.m2.1">R</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> such that the family</p>
      <equation xml:id="S1.Ex1">
        <Math mode="display" tex="\{D^{j}T^{k}\psi\;:\&gt;j,k\in\mathbb{Z}\}" text="conditional-set@(D ^ j * T ^ k * psi, list@(j, k) element-of Z)" xml:id="S1.Ex1.m1">
          <XMath>

                <XMRef idref="S1.Ex1.m1.4"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.Ex1.m1.3">
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="2.8pt">ψ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP" rpadding="2.2pt">:</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.Ex1.m1.4">
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Ex1.m1.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Ex1.m1.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Ex1.m1.1">j</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Ex1.m1.2">k</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>is an orthonormal basis for <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\mathbb{R})" text="L ^ 2 * R" xml:id="S1.p3.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m3.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p3.m3.1">R</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S1.p3.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the
operator of translation by <Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="S1.p3.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, i.e., <Math mode="inline" tex="T\xi(x)=\xi(x-1)," text="T * xi * x = xi * (x - 1)" xml:id="S1.p3.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m6.2"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p3.m6.2">
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m6.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p3.m6.1">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m6.2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.p3.m6.2.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> <Math mode="inline" tex="\xi\in L^{2}(\mathbb{R})," text="xi element-of L ^ 2 * R" xml:id="S1.p3.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m7.2"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p3.m7.2">
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m7.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p3.m7.1">R</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
and where <Math mode="inline" tex="D" text="D" xml:id="S1.p3.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is dilation by <Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S1.p3.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, i.e., <Math mode="inline" tex="D\xi(x)=\sqrt{2}\xi(2x)" text="D * xi * x = square-root@(2) * xi * 2 * x" xml:id="S1.p3.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m10.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p3.m10.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="square-root"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p3.m10.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.p3.m10.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
One of the principal problems in the study of wavelets is to construct
them with various pre-assigned properties. That is, one wants to “tune”
the parameters that enter into the analysis of wavelets so that the
wavelet one constructs exhibits the prescribed properties. So one’s
first task is to identify those parameters and to understand the relations
<!--  %**** String Line 125 **** -->among them.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p4">
      <p>Fractals, on the other hand, are spaces that possess some sort of
scaling. That is, as is customarily expressed, fractals exhibit the
same features at all scales. How to make this statement precise and
how to construct such spaces in useful ways are, of course, the objects
of considerable research. Most of the known examples of fractals are
closely connected to spaces endowed with a local homeomorphism that
is not injective. This may seem like a banal oversimplification, but
reflection on it does lead to natural representations of the Cuntz
relations, as we shall see, that are intrinsic to the geometry of
the situation. Since wavelets have a natural scaling built into them,
it is natural contemplate the possibility of building natural wavelet-like
orthonormal bases in <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}" text="L ^ 2" xml:id="S1.p4.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-spaces erected on fractals. This is
indeed possible, and much of the work by Jorgensen and his co-authors
has been devoted to realizing the possibilities.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p5">
      <p>Our contribution is to observe that the Deaconu-Renault groupoid associated
with a local homeomorphism of a compact Hausdorff space provides a
natural environment in which to set up fractal analysis, and that
the <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S1.p5.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebras of the groupoids carry natural, geometrically
induced families of isometries. The representations that Jorgensen
and his collaborators study come from representations of this groupoid.
Further, wavelets and other orthonormal bases on the fractals are
seen to be artifacts of the representation theory of the groupoid.
<!--  %**** String Line 150 **** -->In short, groupoids help to clarify constructions of both fractals
and wavelets and help to analyze the parameters involved.</p>
    </para>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" xml:id="S2">
    <tags>
      <tag>2</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§2</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">2</tag>The setup</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">2</tag>The setup</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S2.p1">
      <p>Throughout this note, <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S2.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> will denote a fixed compact Hausdorff space
and <Math mode="inline" tex="T:X\rightarrow X" text="T colon X rightarrow X" xml:id="S2.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="rightarrow" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> will denote a surjective local homeomorphism.
One can relax these hypotheses in various ways and in various situations,
but we shall not explore the possibilities here. The principal examples
to keep in mind are the following.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_example" inlist="thm theorem:example" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1">
      <tags>
        <tag>Example 2.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">2.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Example 2.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Example 2.1</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1">
        <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be the circle or torus <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbb{T}" text="T" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The local homeomorphism
in this case is also an endomorphism of the abelian group structure
on <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbb{T}" text="T" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>: <Math mode="inline" tex="T(z)=z^{N}," text="T * z = z ^ N" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m4.2"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m4.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m4.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m4.1">z</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> <Math mode="inline" tex="z\in\mathbb{T}" text="z element-of T" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="N" text="N" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is
a natural number. The case when <Math mode="inline" tex="N=2" text="N = 2" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, provides a link to “classical”
wavelets.</p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_example" inlist="thm theorem:example" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2">
      <tags>
        <tag>Example 2.2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">2.2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Example 2.2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Example 2.2</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1">
        <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be an <Math mode="inline" tex="n\times n" text="n * n" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> dilation matrix. That is, suppose <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
has integer entries and that the determinant of <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has absolute
value <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (which must be a positive integer) that is greater than
<Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. If we view the <Math mode="inline" tex="n" text="n" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-torus, <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbb{T}^{n}" text="T ^ n" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, as the quotient
<!--  %**** String Line 175 **** -->group <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbb{R}^{n}/\mathbb{Z}^{n}" text="R ^ n / Z ^ n" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, then <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> induces a local
homeomorphism <Math mode="inline" tex="T:\mathbb{T}^{n}\rightarrow\mathbb{T}^{n}" text="T colon T ^ n rightarrow T ^ n" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="rightarrow" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> via the
formula <Math mode="inline" tex="T(x+\mathbb{Z}^{n})=Ax+\mathbb{Z}^{n}" text="T * (x + Z ^ n) = A * x + Z ^ n" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m12.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m12.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
<Math mode="inline" tex="x+\mathbb{Z}^{n}\in\mathbb{T}^{n}" text="x + Z ^ n element-of T ^ n" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
It is not difficult to see that <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-to-<Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_example" inlist="thm theorem:example" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3">
      <tags>
        <tag>Example 2.3</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">2.3</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Example 2.3</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Example 2.3</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1">
        <p>In this example we connect our discussion to the theory of iterated
function systems, which is one of the main ways to construct fractals
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="mB88" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. Assume <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a compact space endowed with a metric,
<Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> say, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="(\varphi_{1},\dots,\varphi_{n})" text="vector@(varphi _ 1, dots, varphi _ n)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m3.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m3.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m3.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m3.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m3.1">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m3.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a system of
maps on <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for which there are constants <Math mode="inline" tex="c_{1}" text="c _ 1" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="c_{2}" text="c _ 2" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such
that <Math mode="inline" tex="0&lt;c_{1}\leq c_{2}&lt;1" text="0 less c _ 1 less= c _ 2 less 1" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and such that <Math mode="inline" tex="c_{1}d(x,y)\leq d(\varphi_{i}(x),\varphi_{i}(y))\leq c_{2}d(x,y)" text="c _ 1 * d * open-interval@(x, y) less= d * open-interval@(varphi _ i * x, varphi _ i * y) less= c _ 2 * d * open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.1">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.2">y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.7"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.8"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.7">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.3"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.3">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.8">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.4"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.4">y</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.5"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.6"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.5">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m8.6">y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
for each <Math mode="inline" tex="i" text="i" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Then each <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{i}" text="varphi _ i" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is homeomorphism onto its
range. Also, the family <Math mode="inline" tex="(\varphi_{1},\dots,\varphi_{n})" text="vector@(varphi _ 1, dots, varphi _ n)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m11.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m11.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m11.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m11.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m11.1">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m11.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> induces
a map <Math mode="inline" tex="\Phi" text="Phi" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="Phi" role="UNKNOWN">Φ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on the space of non-empty closed (and hence compact)
subsets <Math mode="inline" tex="K" text="K" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> via the formula</p>
        <equation xml:id="S2.Ex2">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\Phi(K)=\cup_{i=1}^{n}\varphi_{i}(K)." text="Phi * K = (union _ (i = 1)) ^ n varphi _ i * K" xml:id="S2.Ex2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.Ex2.m1.3"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex2.m1.3">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Phi" role="UNKNOWN">Φ</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Ex2.m1.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex2.m1.1">K</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp meaning="union" role="ADDOP">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp meaning="union" role="ADDOP">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.Ex2.m1.2"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex2.m1.2">K</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>It is then easy to see that <Math mode="inline" tex="\Phi" text="Phi" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="Phi" role="UNKNOWN">Φ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a strict contraction in the
Hausdorff metric on the space of nonempty closed subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and
so there is a unique nonempty compact subset <Math mode="inline" tex="K" text="K" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that
<Math mode="inline" tex="\Phi(K)=K" text="Phi * K = K" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Phi" role="UNKNOWN">Φ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m19.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m19.1">K</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. This <Math mode="inline" tex="K" text="K" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is called <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">the</text> invariant subset of the
<!--  %**** String Line 200 **** -->system. It is the fractal associated with the system. We shall assume
that <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the invariant set. It is important to note that there
may be overlap between <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{i}(X)" text="varphi _ i * X" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m22.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m22.1">X</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{j}(X)" text="varphi _ j * X" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m23">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m23.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m23.1">X</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for
<Math mode="inline" tex="i\neq j" text="i not-equals j" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m24">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Consequently, the <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{i}" text="varphi _ i" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m25">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> need not be branches of
the inverse of a local homeomorphism. One way to “get around”
this limitation is to <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">lift</text> the system in the sense of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="mB88" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Page
155]</cite>.
For this purpose, let <Math mode="inline" tex="E^{\infty}" text="E ^ infinity" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m26">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> the space of infinite words over
the alphabet <Math mode="inline" tex="E=\{1,\dots,n\}" text="E = set@(1, dots, n)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m27">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m27.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m27.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m27.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m27.1">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m27.2">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m27.3">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Then in the product topology <Math mode="inline" tex="E^{\infty}" text="E ^ infinity" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m28">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
is compact and we can give <Math mode="inline" tex="E^{\infty}" text="E ^ infinity" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m29">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> a complete metric such that
the maps <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma_{i}:E^{\infty}\rightarrow E^{\infty}" text="sigma _ i colon E ^ infinity rightarrow E ^ infinity" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m30">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="rightarrow" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> defined by
the formula <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma_{i}(w)=(i,w_{1},w_{2},\ldots)" text="sigma _ i * w = vector@(i, w _ 1, w _ 2, ldots)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m31">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m31.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m31.1">w</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m31.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m31.4"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m31.5"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m31.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m31.2">i</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m31.4">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m31.5">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="ldots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m31.3">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where
<Math mode="inline" tex="w=(w_{1},w_{2},\ldots)" text="w = vector@(w _ 1, w _ 2, ldots)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m32">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m32.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m32.3"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m32.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m32.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m32.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="ldots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m32.1">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
are contractions of the same type as the <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{i}" text="varphi _ i" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m33">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The iterated
function system on <Math mode="inline" tex="X\times E^{\infty}" text="X * E ^ infinity" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m34">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> ,
<Math mode="inline" tex="(\tilde{\varphi_{1}},\dots,\tilde{\varphi_{n}})" text="vector@(tilde@(varphi _ 1), dots, tilde@(varphi _ n))" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m35">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m35.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m35.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m35.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m35.1">
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m35.2">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m35.3">
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
defined by the formula</p>
        <equation xml:id="S2.Ex3">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\tilde{\varphi_{i}}(x,w)=(\varphi_{i}(x),\sigma_{i}(w))" text="tilde@(varphi _ i) * open-interval@(x, w) = open-interval@(varphi _ i * x, sigma _ i * w)" xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Ex3.m1.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Ex3.m1.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1.2">w</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Ex3.m1.5"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Ex3.m1.6"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1.5">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Ex3.m1.3"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1.3">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1.6">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Ex3.m1.4"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1.4">w</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>then has a unique nonempty closed invariant subset <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{X}" text="tilde@(X)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m36">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of
<Math mode="inline" tex="X\times E^{\infty}" text="X * E ^ infinity" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m37">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. That is
<Math mode="inline" tex="\cup_{i=1}^{n}\tilde{\varphi_{i}}(\tilde{X})=\tilde{X}" text="(union _ (i = 1)) ^ n tilde@(varphi _ i) * tilde@(X) = tilde@(X)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m38">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp meaning="union" role="ADDOP">
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp meaning="union" role="ADDOP">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m38.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m38.1">
                          <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
The system <Math mode="inline" tex="(\tilde{\varphi_{1}},\dots,\tilde{\varphi_{n}})" text="vector@(tilde@(varphi _ 1), dots, tilde@(varphi _ n))" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m39">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m39.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m39.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m39.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m39.1">
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m39.2">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m39.3">
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{X}" text="tilde@(X)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m40">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
is called the <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">lifted system.</text> The ranges of the <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{\varphi_{i}}" text="tilde@(varphi _ i)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m41">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
are disjoint and so there is a local homeomorphism <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m42">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{X}" text="tilde@(X)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m43">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
such that the <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{\varphi_{i}}" text="tilde@(varphi _ i)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m44">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are the branches of the inverse
<!--  %**** String Line 225 **** -->of <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m45">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. As is discussed in Section 4.6 of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="mB88" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, the
systems<Math mode="inline" tex="(\varphi_{1},\dots,\varphi_{n})" text="vector@(varphi _ 1, dots, varphi _ n)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m46">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m46.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m46.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m46.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m46.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m46.1">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm3.p1.m46.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
