    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:thm:ExelCP" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4">
      <tags>
        <tag>Theorem 3.4</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">3.4</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 3.4</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 3.4</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">In the context of our groupoid, <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, let
<Math mode="inline" tex="A=C^{*}(R_{\infty})" text="A = C ^ * * R _ infinity" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m2.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>,
let <Math mode="inline" tex="\alpha" text="alpha" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be the endomorphism of <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> defined by equation
<!--  %**** String Line 450 **** -->(<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:alphainfty"/>),
let <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{L}" text="L" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be the associated transfer operator (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:transferinfty"/>)
and let <Math mode="inline" tex="M_{\mathcal{L}}" text="M _ L" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be the correspondence over <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> defined
by Brownlowe and Raeburn that we just described. Then the identity
representation <Math mode="inline" tex="\iota" text="iota" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="iota" role="UNKNOWN">ι</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> mapping <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(R_{\infty})" text="C ^ * * R _ infinity" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m9.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m9.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> into <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m10.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m10.1">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
together with the isometry <Math mode="inline" tex="S" text="S" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> defined by equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:isometry"/>),
determine a Cuntz-Pimsner representation <Math mode="inline" tex="(\iota,\psi)" text="open-interval@(iota, psi)" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m12.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m12.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="iota" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m12.1">ι</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="psi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m12.2">ψ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="M_{\mathcal{L}}" text="M _ L" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
in <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m14.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m14.1">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> that implements an isomorphism of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{O}(M_{\mathcal{L}})" text="O * M _ L" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m15">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">O</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m15.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m15.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
onto <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m16">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m16.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmthm4.p1.m16.1">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S3.p9">
        <p>Equation CP.1 follows from equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:Stacey1"/>) and equation
CP.2, which is the same as the second equation of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:StaceyXpdRep"/>,
is a straightforward calculation. We need to verify equation CP.3.
Since <Math mode="inline" tex="\xi_{0}" text="xi _ 0" xml:id="S3.p9.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a cyclic vector for the left action of <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S3.p9.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on
<Math mode="inline" tex="M_{\mathcal{L}}" text="M _ L" xml:id="S3.p9.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{K}(M_{\mathcal{L}})" text="K * M _ L" xml:id="S3.p9.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m4.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.p9.m4.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the closed
linear span of elements of the form <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi(a)\xi_{0}\otimes\xi_{0}^{*}\phi(b)" text="((phi * a * xi _ 0) tensor-product (xi _ 0) ^ *) * phi * b" xml:id="S3.p9.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m5.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m5.1">a</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m5.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m5.2">b</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
where <Math mode="inline" tex="a" text="a" xml:id="S3.p9.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="b" text="b" xml:id="S3.p9.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> range over <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S3.p9.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. So, if <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi(a)" text="phi * a" xml:id="S3.p9.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m9.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m9.1">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is compact,
there is a sequence whose terms are of the form
<Math mode="inline" tex="\sum_{i}\phi(a_{i})\xi_{0}\otimes\xi_{0}^{*}\phi(b_{i})" text="(sum _ i)@(((phi * a _ i * xi _ 0) tensor-product (xi _ 0) ^ *) * phi * b _ i)" xml:id="S3.p9.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="tensor-product" name="otimes" role="MULOP">⊗</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m10.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S3.p9.m10.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m10.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.p9.m10.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
that converges to <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi(a)" text="phi * a" xml:id="S3.p9.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m11.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m11.1">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{K}(M_{\mathcal{L}})" text="K * M _ L" xml:id="S3.p9.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m12.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.p9.m12.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. So,
if we apply <Math mode="inline" tex="\iota(a)" text="iota * a" xml:id="S3.p9.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN">ι</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m13.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m13.1">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to an element of the form
<Math mode="inline" tex="\iota(b)S=\psi(\phi(b)\xi_{0})" text="iota * b * S = psi * phi * b * xi _ 0" xml:id="S3.p9.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN">ι</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m14.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m14.1">b</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m14.3"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.p9.m14.3">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m14.2"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m14.2">b</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
then we may write the following equation</p>
        <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_eqnarray" xml:id="A0.EGx2">
          <equation labels="LABEL:eq:defining" xml:id="S3.Ex15">
            <MathFork>
              <Math tex="\displaystyle\iota(a)\iota(b)S=\psi(\phi(a)\phi(b)\xi_{0})=\lim\psi(\sum_{i}%&#10;\phi(a_{i})\xi_{0}\otimes\xi_{0}^{*}\phi(b_{i})(\phi(b)\xi_{0}))=\lim\sum_{i}%&#10;\iota(a_{i})SS^{*}\iota(b_{i})\iota(b)S=\lim\sum_{i}\iota(a_{i})S\iota(%&#10;\mathcal{L}(b_{i}b))=\lim\sum_{i}\iota(a_{i})\iota(\alpha\circ\mathcal{L}(b_{i%&#10;}b))S=\lim\sum_{i}(\psi,\iota)^{(1)}(\phi(a_{i})\xi_{0}\otimes\xi_{0}^{*}\phi(%&#10;b_{i}))(\iota(b)S)=(\psi,\iota)^{(1)}(\phi(a))(\iota(b)S)." text="iota * a * iota * b * S = psi * phi * a * phi * b * xi _ 0 = limit@(psi * (sum _ i)@(((phi * a _ i * xi _ 0) tensor-product (xi _ 0) ^ *) * phi * b _ i * phi * b * xi _ 0)) = limit@((sum _ i)@(iota * a _ i * S * S ^ * * iota * b _ i * iota * b * S)) = limit@((sum _ i)@(iota * a _ i * S * iota * L * b _ i * b)) = limit@((sum _ i)@(iota * a _ i * iota * (alpha compose L) * b _ i * b * S)) = limit@((sum _ i)@((open-interval@(psi, iota)) ^ 1 * ((phi * a _ i * xi _ 0) tensor-product (xi _ 0) ^ *) * phi * b _ i * iota * b * S)) = (open-interval@(psi, iota)) ^ 1 * phi * a * iota * b * S" xml:id="S3.Ex15.m4">

                                      </XMWrap>
                                    </XMDual>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMath>
                    </Math></td>

            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>which shows that for all <Math mode="inline" tex="T\in\mathcal{K}(M_{\mathcal{L}})," text="T element-of K * M _ L" xml:id="S3.p9.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m15.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.p9.m15.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m15.1.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S3.p9.m15.1.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
<Math mode="inline" tex="(\psi,\iota)^{(1)}(T)" text="(open-interval@(psi, iota)) ^ 1 * T" xml:id="S3.p9.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m16.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m16.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m16.2">ψ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m16.3">ι</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m16.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.p9.m16.1">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m16.4"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m16.4">T</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
is determined by its values on elements of the form <Math mode="inline" tex="\iota(b)S" text="iota * b * S" xml:id="S3.p9.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN">ι</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m17.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m17.1">b</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Thus, equations (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:defining"/>) and (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:definingbis"/>) together
show that if <Math mode="inline" tex="a\in J" text="a element-of J" xml:id="S3.p9.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, then <Math mode="inline" tex="\iota(a)=(\psi,\iota)^{(1)}(\phi(a))" text="iota * a = (open-interval@(psi, iota)) ^ 1 * phi * a" xml:id="S3.p9.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN">ι</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m19.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m19.2">a</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m19.3"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m19.4"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m19.3">ψ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m19.4">ι</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m19.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S3.p9.m19.1">1</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m19.6"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.p9.m19.6">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m19.5"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m19.5">a</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Thus <Math mode="inline" tex="(\iota,\psi)" text="open-interval@(iota, psi)" xml:id="S3.p9.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m20.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m20.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m20.1">ι</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m20.2">ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a Cuntz-Pimsner representation, the range
of which clearly generates <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S3.p9.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m21.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m21.1">G</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. So all we need to show is
that <Math mode="inline" tex="\iota\times\psi" text="iota * psi" xml:id="S3.p9.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN">ι</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is injective. But this is immediate from the
injectivity of <Math mode="inline" tex="\iota" text="iota" xml:id="S3.p9.m23">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN">ι</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, by the gauge-invariant uniqueness theorem
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="FMR03" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 4.1]</cite>.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <para xml:id="S3.p10">
      <p><text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">Proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:StaceyXpdRep"/>.</text> The fact that conditions
<!--  %**** String Line 500 **** -->1. and 2. of the theorem are satisfied is an easy calculation. The
“converse” assertion follows from Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm:ExelCP"/>
because, as is easily seen, if <Math mode="inline" tex="(\pi,S_{+})" text="open-interval@(pi, S _ +)" xml:id="S3.p10.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p10.m1.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p10.m1.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p10.m1.1">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S3.p10.m1.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are given, acting on
a Hilbert space <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S3.p10.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, say, then we obtain a Cuntz-Pimsner representation
<Math mode="inline" tex="(\pi,\psi)" text="open-interval@(pi, psi)" xml:id="S3.p10.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p10.m3.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p10.m3.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p10.m3.1">π</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p10.m3.2">ψ</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="M_{\mathcal{L}}" text="M _ L" xml:id="S3.p10.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> by setting <Math mode="inline" tex="\psi(\xi):=\pi(\xi)S_{+}" text="psi * xi assign pi * xi * S _ +" xml:id="S3.p10.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p10.m5.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p10.m5.1">ξ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p10.m5.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p10.m5.2">ξ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
This representation “integrates” to give a <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S3.p10.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-representation
of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{O}(\mathcal{X})" text="O * X" xml:id="S3.p10.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">O</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p10.m7.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p10.m7.1">X</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, which by Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:DeaconuIsoThm"/>
is <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S3.p10.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p10.m8.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p10.m8.1">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. <Math mode="inline" tex="\square" text="square" xml:id="S3.p10.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="square" role="UNKNOWN">□</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math></p>
    </para>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" xml:id="S4">
    <tags>
      <tag>4</tag>

    <title><tag close=". ">4</tag>Filter Banks</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">4</tag>Filter Banks</toctitle>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_defn" inlist="thm theorem:defn" xml:id="S4.Thmthm1">
      <tags>
        <tag>Definition 4.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">4.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Definition 4.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Definition 4.1</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S4.Thmthm1.p1">
        <p>A family <Math mode="inline" tex="\{m_{i}\}_{i=1,\dots,N}\subseteq\mathcal{X}" text="(set@(m _ i)) _ (i = list@(1, dots, N)) subset-of-or-equals X" xml:id="S4.Thmthm1.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="subset-of-or-equals" name="subseteq" role="RELOP">⊆</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Thmthm1.p1.m1.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.Thmthm1.p1.m1.4">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.Thmthm1.p1.m1.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.Thmthm1.p1.m1.2"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.Thmthm1.p1.m1.3"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S4.Thmthm1.p1.m1.1">1</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S4.Thmthm1.p1.m1.2">…</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Thmthm1.p1.m1.3">N</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is called
a <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">filter bank</text> if it is an orthonormal basis for <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{X}" text="X" xml:id="S4.Thmthm1.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S4.p1">
      <p>This means that <Math mode="inline" tex="\langle m_{i},m_{j}\rangle=0" text="list@(m _ i, m _ j) = 0" xml:id="S4.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p1.m1.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p1.m1.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.p1.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.p1.m1.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> if <Math mode="inline" tex="i\neq j" text="i not-equals j" xml:id="S4.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and
<Math mode="inline" tex="\langle m_{i},m_{i}\rangle=1" text="list@(m _ i, m _ i) = 1" xml:id="S4.p1.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p1.m3.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p1.m3.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.p1.m3.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.p1.m3.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Note that this last condition is
much stronger than asserting that each <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{i}" text="m _ i" xml:id="S4.p1.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> has norm <Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="S4.p1.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. In
general a module <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{X}" text="X" xml:id="S4.p1.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> need not have an orthonormal basis.
Even some modules built on <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbb{T}^{n}" text="T ^ n" xml:id="S4.p1.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with the map <Math mode="inline" tex="z\to Az" text="z to A * z" xml:id="S4.p1.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
may fail to have orthonormal bases. However, on <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbb{T}^{1}" text="T ^ 1" xml:id="S4.p1.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
they exist.</p>
    </para>
<!--  %**** String Line 525 **** -->    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_defn" inlist="thm theorem:defn" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2">
      <tags>
        <tag>Definition 4.2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">4.2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Definition 4.2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Definition 4.2</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1">
        <p>If <Math mode="inline" tex="\{m_{i}\}_{i=1,\dots,N}" text="(set@(m _ i)) _ (i = list@(1, dots, N))" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m1.4"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m1.4">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m1.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m1.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m1.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m1.1">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m1.2">…</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m1.3">N</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a filter bank, we call <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{1}" text="m _ 1" xml:id="S4.Thmthm2.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
the <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">low pass filter</text> and the rest <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">high pass filters</text>.</p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S4.p2">
      <p>One problem of great importance is to decide when a function <Math mode="inline" tex="m" text="m" xml:id="S4.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
in <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{X}" text="X" xml:id="S4.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> satisfying <Math mode="inline" tex="\langle m,m\rangle=1" text="list@(m, m) = 1" xml:id="S4.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p2.m3.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p2.m3.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p2.m3.1">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p2.m3.2">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> can be completed
to an orthonormal basis, i.e., when can such a function <Math mode="inline" tex="m" text="m" xml:id="S4.p2.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be viewed
as a low pass filter in a filter bank. This depends to a great extent
upon the underlying geometry of the situation under consideration,
as Packer and Rieffel have shown <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="PR03,PR04" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S4.p3">
      <p>We note, too, that while we have been emphasizing the topological
situation, there is a Borel version of our analysis. In this situation
Borel orthonormal bases always exist and low pass filters can be completed
to a filter bank.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:StaceyXpd2" xml:id="S4.Thmthm3">
      <tags>
        <tag>Theorem 4.3</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">4.3</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 4.3</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 4.3</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S4.Thmthm3.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Define <Math mode="inline" tex="\beta:C(X)\to C(X)" text="beta colon C * X to C * X" xml:id="S4.Thmthm3.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.Thmthm3.p1.m1.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Thmthm3.p1.m1.1">X</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.Thmthm3.p1.m1.2"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Thmthm3.p1.m1.2">X</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> by <Math mode="inline" tex="\beta(f)=f\circ T" text="beta * f = f compose T" xml:id="S4.Thmthm3.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Thmthm3.p1.m2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Thmthm3.p1.m2.1">f</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="compose" name="circ" role="MULOP">∘</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>,
<Math mode="inline" tex="f\in C(X)" text="f element-of C * X" xml:id="S4.Thmthm3.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.Thmthm3.p1.m3.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Thmthm3.p1.m3.1">X</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, and adopt the notation of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:DeaconuIsoThm"/>.
The following assertions are valid in <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S4.Thmthm3.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.Thmthm3.p1.m4.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.Thmthm3.p1.m4.1">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> :</text></p>

            <para xml:id="S4.I1.i2.p1">
              <p><text font="italic">If </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\{m_{1},\dots,m_{n}\}" text="set@(m _ 1, dots, m _ n)" xml:id="S4.I1.i2.p1.m1">

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S4.I1.i2.p1.m1.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>

                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S4.I1.i2.p1.m1.3">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> is a filter bank and if </text><Math mode="inline" tex="S_{i}:=\psi(m_{i})" text="S _ i assign psi * m _ i" xml:id="S4.I1.i2.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.I1.i2.p1.m2.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S4.I1.i2.p1.m2.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic">,
then </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\{S_{i}\}" text="set@(S _ i)" xml:id="S4.I1.i2.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.I1.i2.p1.m3.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S4.I1.i2.p1.m3.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> is a Cuntz family of isometries in </text><Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S4.I1.i2.p1.m4">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.I1.i2.p1.m4.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.I1.i2.p1.m4.1">G</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic">
such that</text></p>
