                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and because <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi(P)=\xi_{0}\otimes\xi_{0}^{*}" text="phi * P = xi _ 0 tensor-product (xi _ 0) ^ *" xml:id="S4.p7.m25">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m25.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m25.1">P</XMTok>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>

                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
On the other hand, the ideal <Math mode="inline" tex="\overline{A\alpha(A)A}" text="overline@(A * alpha * A * A)" xml:id="S4.p7.m26">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m26.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m26.1">A</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is proper.
Thus, the relative Cuntz-Pimsner algebra determined by
<Math mode="inline" tex="\overline{A\alpha(A)A}\cap J" text="overline@(A * alpha * A * A) intersection J" xml:id="S4.p7.m27">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="overline" role="OVERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m27.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m27.1">A</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
has the Cuntz-Pimsner algebra <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{O}(M_{\mathcal{L}})" text="O * M _ L" xml:id="S4.p7.m28">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">O</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m28.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.p7.m28.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> as a
proper quotient, by <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="FMR03" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Proposition 3.14]</cite>. So, in our setting,
we see that <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S4.p7.m29">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m29.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m29.1">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a proper quotient of
<Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(R_{\infty})\rtimes_{\alpha,\mathcal{L}}\mathbb{N}\simeq C^{*}(R_{\infty}%&#10;)\rtimes_{1}^{\alpha}\mathbb{N}" text="(C ^ * * R _ infinity) right-normal-factor-semidirect-product _ (list@(alpha, L)) N similar-to-or-equals (C ^ * * R _ infinity) (right-normal-factor-semidirect-product _ 1) ^ alpha N" xml:id="S4.p7.m30">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="similar-to-or-equals" name="simeq" role="RELOP">≃</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp meaning="right-normal-factor-semidirect-product" role="MULOP">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="right-normal-factor-semidirect-product" name="rtimes" role="MULOP">⋊</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m30.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m30.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m30.1">α</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m30.2">L</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m30.3"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.p7.m30.3">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp meaning="right-normal-factor-semidirect-product" role="MULOP">
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp meaning="right-normal-factor-semidirect-product" role="MULOP">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="right-normal-factor-semidirect-product" name="rtimes" role="MULOP">⋊</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m30.4"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S4.p7.m30.4">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
On the other hand, Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:StaceyXpd2"/> suggests that <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S4.p7.m31">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m31.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m31.1">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
may be the Stacey crossed product <Math mode="inline" tex="C(X)\rtimes_{n}^{\beta}\mathbb{N}" text="(C * X) (right-normal-factor-semidirect-product _ n) ^ beta N" xml:id="S4.p7.m32">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMApp meaning="right-normal-factor-semidirect-product" role="MULOP">
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp meaning="right-normal-factor-semidirect-product" role="MULOP">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="right-normal-factor-semidirect-product" name="rtimes" role="MULOP">⋊</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m32.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m32.1">X</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,
but we are unable to determine the precise circumstances under which
this may happen. Nevertheless, as Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:StaceyXpd2"/> shows,
<Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S4.p7.m33">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m33.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m33.1">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> contains a Cuntz covariant representation of order <Math mode="inline" tex="n" text="n" xml:id="S4.p7.m34">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
of <Math mode="inline" tex="(C(X),\beta)" text="open-interval@(C * X, beta)" xml:id="S4.p7.m35">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m35.3"/>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m35.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S4.p7.m35.3">
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m35.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m35.1">X</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m35.2">β</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and therefore any <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S4.p7.m36">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S4.p7.m37">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m37.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m37.1">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
produces automatically a Cuntz-covariant representation of <Math mode="inline" tex="(C(X),\beta)" text="open-interval@(C * X, beta)" xml:id="S4.p7.m38">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m38.3"/>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m38.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S4.p7.m38.3">
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m38.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m38.1">X</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m38.2">β</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
These are the starting point of Bratteli and Jorgensen’s analysis
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BJ97" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Proposition 1.1]</cite>.</p>
    </para>
  </section>

      <p>Renault worked out the structure theory of the most general representation
of any groupoid <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S5.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebra in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="jR87" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. We discuss here
certain aspects of it in our special setting that is relevant for
applications to wavelets. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi:C^{*}(G)\to\mathcal{B}(\mathcal{H})" text="pi colon C ^ * * G to B * H" xml:id="S5.p1.m2">
          <XMath>

be a <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S5.p1.m3">

            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-representation, where <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S5.p1.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for the moment is an arbitrary
locally compact groupoid with Haar system <Math mode="inline" tex="\{\lambda^{u}\}_{u\in G^{(0)}}" text="(set@(lambda ^ u)) _ (u element-of G ^ 0)" xml:id="S5.p1.m5">
          <XMath>

                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p1.m5.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
Then <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S5.p1.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> determines and is determined by a triple <Math mode="inline" tex="(\mu,\mathcal{H},U)" text="vector@(mu, H, U)" xml:id="S5.p1.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="vector"/>

              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>

            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,
where <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S5.p1.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a quasi-invariant measure on <Math mode="inline" tex="G^{(0)}=X" text="G ^ 0 = X" xml:id="S5.p1.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p1.m9.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.p1.m9.1">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>; <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{H}" text="H" xml:id="S5.p1.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
is a (Borel) Hilbert bundle on <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S5.p1.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S5.p1.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a representation
of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S5.p1.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{H}" text="H" xml:id="S5.p1.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The relation between <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S5.p1.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and the triple
<Math mode="inline" tex="(\mu,\mathcal{H},U)" text="vector@(mu, H, U)" xml:id="S5.p1.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                <XMRef idref="S5.p1.m16.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S5.p1.m16.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S5.p1.m16.3"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p1.m16.1">μ</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p1.m16.2">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p1.m16.3">U</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is expressed through the equation</p>
      <equation xml:id="S5.Ex17">
        <Math mode="display" tex="\pi(f)\xi(u)=\int_{G^{u}}f(\gamma)(U(\gamma)\xi(s(\gamma)))\Delta^{\frac{1}{2}%&#10;}(\gamma)\,d\lambda^{u}(\gamma)," text="pi * f * xi * u = (integral _ (G ^ u))@(f * gamma * U * gamma * xi * s * gamma * Delta ^ (1 / 2) * gamma * differential-d@(lambda ^ u) * gamma)" xml:id="S5.Ex17.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S5.Ex17.m1.8"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex17.m1.8">
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Ex17.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>

                      <XMRef idref="S5.Ex17.m1.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="integral" name="int" role="INTOP">∫</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.Ex17.m1.3"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.Ex17.m1.8.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex17.m1.8.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S5.Ex17.m1.4"/>
                              <XMWrap>

                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      <XMApp>

                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>

            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="\xi" text="xi" xml:id="S5.p1.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is an <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\mu)" text="L ^ 2 * mu" xml:id="S5.p1.m18">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S5.p1.m18.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p1.m18.1">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-section of the bundle <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{H}" text="H" xml:id="S5.p1.m19">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
and <Math mode="inline" tex="\Delta" text="Delta" xml:id="S5.p1.m20">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Delta" role="UNKNOWN">Δ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the modular function of the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu." text="mu" xml:id="S5.p1.m21">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S5.p1.m21.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p1.m21.1">μ</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> In more
detail, let <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu=\int_{G^{(0)}}\lambda^{u}\,d\mu(u)" text="nu = (integral _ (G ^ 0))@(lambda ^ u * differential-d@(mu) * u)" xml:id="S5.p1.m22">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="integral" name="int" role="INTOP">∫</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p1.m22.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.p1.m22.1">0</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" meaning="differential-d" role="DIFFOP">d</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p1.m22.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p1.m22.2">u</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and let <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu^{-1}" text="nu ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S5.p1.m23">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
be the image of <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S5.p1.m24">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> under inversion. Then to say <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S5.p1.m25">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is quasi-invariant
is to say that <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S5.p1.m26">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu^{-1}" text="nu ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S5.p1.m27">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are mutually absolutely continuous.
In this case, <Math mode="inline" tex="\Delta" text="Delta" xml:id="S5.p1.m28">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Delta" role="UNKNOWN">Δ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is defined to be <Math mode="inline" tex="\frac{d\nu^{-1}}{d\nu}" text="(d * nu ^ (- 1)) / (d * nu)" xml:id="S5.p1.m29">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S5.p2">
      <p>Specializing now to the setting where our groupoid <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S5.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the Deaconu-Renault
groupoid associated to the local homeomorphism <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S5.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on the compact
Hausdorff space <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S5.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, it is not difficult to see that the measure
<Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S5.p2.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is quasi-invariant in the fashion just described if and only
<!--  %**** String Line 675 **** -->if <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu\circ T^{-1}\ll\mu" text="mu compose T ^ (- 1) lessless mu" xml:id="S5.p2.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="much-less-than" name="ll" role="RELOP">≪</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="compose" name="circ" role="MULOP">∘</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. In this event, if we let <Math mode="inline" tex="D" text="D" xml:id="S5.p2.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> denote
the Radon-Nikodym derivative <Math mode="inline" tex="\frac{d\mu\circ T^{-1}}{d\mu}" text="((d * mu) compose T ^ (- 1)) / (d * mu)" xml:id="S5.p2.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="compose" name="circ" role="MULOP">∘</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, then
the modular function <Math mode="inline" tex="\Delta" text="Delta" xml:id="S5.p2.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Delta" role="UNKNOWN">Δ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is given by the equation</p>
      <equation xml:id="S5.Ex18">
        <Math mode="display" tex="\Delta(x,m-n,y)=\frac{D(x)D(Tx)\cdots D(T^{m-1}x)}{D(y)D(Ty)\cdots D(T^{n-1}y)}." text="Delta * vector@(x, m - n, y) = (D * x * D * T * x * cdots * D * T ^ (m - 1) * x) / (D * y * D * T * y * cdots * D * T ^ (n - 1) * y)" xml:id="S5.Ex18.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S5.Ex18.m1.9"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex18.m1.9">

                  <XMApp>

                    <XMDual>

                        <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.Ex18.m1.7"/>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.Ex18.m1.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                        <XMRef idref="S5.Ex18.m1.4"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.Ex18.m1.5"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex18.m1.5">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok name="cdots" role="ID">⋯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.Ex18.m1.6"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex18.m1.6">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S5.p3">
      <p>A measurable function <Math mode="inline" tex="D" text="D" xml:id="S5.p3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> defines also a transfer operator
<Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{L}_{D}^{*}:M(X)\to M(X)" text="(L _ D) ^ * colon M * X to M * X" xml:id="S5.p3.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p3.m2.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p3.m2.1">X</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p3.m2.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p3.m2.2">X</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
by the equation</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:eq:Transfer" xml:id="S5.E9">
        <tags>
          <tag>(9)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">9</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="\mathcal{L}_{D}^{*}(\mu)(f):=\int_{X}\sum_{Ty=x}D(y)f(y)\,d\mu(x)." text="(L _ D) ^ * * mu * f assign (integral _ X)@((sum _ (T * y = x))@(D * y * f * y * d * mu * x))" xml:id="S5.E9.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S5.E9.m1.6"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S5.E9.m1.6">
                  <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.E9.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>

                      <XMRef idref="S5.E9.m1.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.E9.m1.2">f</XMTok>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="integral" name="int" role="INTOP">∫</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                        <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.E9.m1.3"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.E9.m1.3">y</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.E9.m1.4"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.E9.m1.4">y</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" rpadding="1.7pt" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.E9.m1.5"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.E9.m1.5">x</XMTok>

                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>

          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>The relevance of the transfer operator <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{L}_{D}^{*}" text="(L _ D) ^ *" xml:id="S5.p3.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> to our
situation was established by Renault in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="jR05" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 7.1]</cite>
and <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="jR03" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Proposition 4.2]</cite>. We state a slightly modified version
of his results.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" xml:id="S5.Thmthm1">
      <tags>
        <tag>Theorem 5.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">5.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 5.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 5.1</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S5.Thmthm1.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">(Renault) Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S5.Thmthm1.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be a probability measure on <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S5.Thmthm1.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S5.Thmthm1.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
is quasi-invariant with respect to <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S5.Thmthm1.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and admits <Math mode="inline" tex="\Delta" text="Delta" xml:id="S5.Thmthm1.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="upright" name="Delta" role="UNKNOWN">Δ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> as Radon-Nikodym
derivative if and only if <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{L}_{D}^{*}(\mu)=\mu" text="(L _ D) ^ * * mu = mu" xml:id="S5.Thmthm1.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Thmthm1.p1.m6.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Thmthm1.p1.m6.1">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S5.p4">
      <p>In applications to wavelets, i.e. to the settings where <Math mode="inline" tex="X=\mathbb{T}" text="X = T" xml:id="S5.p4.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
or <Math mode="inline" tex="X=\mathbb{T}^{n}" text="X = T ^ n" xml:id="S5.p4.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S5.p4.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the power function <Math mode="inline" tex="z\to z^{N}" text="z to z ^ N" xml:id="S5.p4.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
or <Math mode="inline" tex="x+\mathbb{Z}^{n}\to Ax+\mathbb{Z}^{n}" text="x + Z ^ n to A * x + Z ^ n" xml:id="S5.p4.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the measure that one usually
<!--  %**** String Line 700 **** -->chooses is Lebesgue measure. Also, the bundle one chooses is the trivial
line bundle <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{H}=\mathbb{T}\times\mathbb{C}" text="H = T * C" xml:id="S5.p4.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> or
<Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{H}=\mathbb{T}^{n}\times\mathbb{C}" text="H = T ^ n * C" xml:id="S5.p4.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
and the representation is the translation representation: <Math mode="inline" tex="U(\gamma):\{s(\gamma)\}\times\mathbb{C}\to\{r(\gamma)\}\times\mathbb{C}" text="U * gamma colon set@(s * gamma) * C to set@(r * gamma) * C" xml:id="S5.p4.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p4.m8.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="gamma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p4.m8.1">γ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p4.m8.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.p4.m8.4">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.p4.m8.2"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="gamma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p4.m8.2">γ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p4.m8.5"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.p4.m8.5">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.p4.m8.3"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="gamma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p4.m8.3">γ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,</p>
      <equation xml:id="S5.Ex19">
        <Math mode="display" tex="U(\gamma)(s(\gamma),c)=(r(\gamma),c)," text="U * gamma * open-interval@(s * gamma, c) = open-interval@(r * gamma, c)" xml:id="S5.Ex19.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S5.Ex19.m1.6"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex19.m1.6">
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Ex19.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="gamma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Ex19.m1.1">γ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.Ex19.m1.6.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.Ex19.m1.3"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex19.m1.6.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S5.Ex19.m1.2"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="gamma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Ex19.m1.2">γ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Ex19.m1.3">c</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Ex19.m1.6.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.Ex19.m1.5"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex19.m1.6.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.Ex19.m1.4"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="gamma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Ex19.m1.4">γ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.Ex19.m1.5">c</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\gamma\in G" text="gamma element-of G" xml:id="S5.p4.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="gamma" role="UNKNOWN">γ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. But we note that some of the recent work of Dutkay
and Roysland <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="DR06,DR07" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> can be formulated in the setting we
are describing by taking more complicated bundles and representations.</p>
    </para>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" xml:id="S6">
    <tags>
      <tag>6</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">6</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§6</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">6</tag>An Example: Classical Wavelets</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">6</tag>An Example: Classical Wavelets</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S6.p1">
      <p>We discuss how the constructs we have described can enter into analysis
of classical wavelets. In this setting, as we have indicated, <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S6.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
is the circle or <Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="S6.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-torus <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbb{T}" text="T" xml:id="S6.p1.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, the local homeomorphism
<Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S6.p1.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is given by squaring: <Math mode="inline" tex="Tz=z^{2}" text="T * z = z ^ 2" xml:id="S6.p1.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, the quasi-invariant measure
<Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S6.p1.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is Lebesgue measure on <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbb{T}" text="T" xml:id="S6.p1.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, the bundle <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{H}" text="H" xml:id="S6.p1.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
is the trivial one-dimensional bundle, and the representation <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S6.p1.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
is translation. The <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}" text="L ^ 2" xml:id="S6.p1.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-sections of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{H}" text="H" xml:id="S6.p1.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is just <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\mu)" text="L ^ 2 * mu" xml:id="S6.p1.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m12.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p1.m12.1">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
and if <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.p1.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the integrated form of the representation associated
to this data, then <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S6.p1.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> represents <Math mode="inline" tex="C(X)" text="C * X" xml:id="S6.p1.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m15.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p1.m15.1">X</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> (viewed as <Math mode="inline" tex="\iota(C(X))" text="iota * C * X" xml:id="S6.p1.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN">ι</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m16.2"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p1.m16.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m16.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p1.m16.1">X</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
in <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S6.p1.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m17.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p1.m17.1">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>) as multiplication operators on <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\mu)" text="L ^ 2 * mu" xml:id="S6.p1.m18">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m18.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p1.m18.1">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Further,
if <Math mode="inline" tex="{\{m}_{i}\}_{i=1,2}" text="(set@(m _ i)) _ (i = list@(1, 2))" xml:id="S6.p1.m19">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set"/>

                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p1.m19.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m19.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m19.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S6.p1.m19.1">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S6.p1.m19.2">2</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a filter bank and if <Math mode="inline" tex="S_{1}" text="S _ 1" xml:id="S6.p1.m20">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="S_{2}" text="S _ 2" xml:id="S6.p1.m21">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
are the isometries it determines as in Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:StaceyXpd2"/>,
<!--  %**** String Line 725 **** -->then <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi(S_{i})\xi(z)=m_{i}(z)\xi(z^{2})" text="pi * S _ i * xi * z = m _ i * z * xi * z ^ 2" xml:id="S6.p1.m22">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>

                  <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m22.4"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="i=1,2" text="i = list@(1, 2)" xml:id="S6.p1.m23">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m23.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m23.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S6.p1.m23.1">1</XMTok>

                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S6.p1.m23.2">2</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Thus
<Math mode="inline" tex="(\pi(S_{1}),\pi(S_{2}))" text="open-interval@(pi * S _ 1, pi * S _ 2)" xml:id="S6.p1.m24">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>

                <XMApp xml:id="S6.p1.m24.1">
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m24.1.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p1.m24.1.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S6.p1.m24.2">
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m24.2.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p1.m24.2.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
is a Cuntz family on <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\mu)" text="L ^ 2 * mu" xml:id="S6.p1.m25">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>

              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m25.1"/>
