    </theorem>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_rem" inlist="thm theorem:rem" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2">
      <tags>
        <tag>Remark 6.2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">6.2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 6.2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="italic">Remark 6.2</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1">
        <p>Mallat’s hypotheses are labeled as equations (38)–(41) on page 76
of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="sM89" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. Equation (38) is our hypothesis 1, equation (39)
is our hypothesis 2., and his equation (41) is our hypothesis 3. Equation
(40) is the assertion that <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{1}" text="m _ 1" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a unit vector in <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{X}" text="X" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
We note, however, that there is a lot of “wiggle room” in these
hypotheses and a lot of work has been devoted to finding their exact
limits. In <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="iD92" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Chapter 6]</cite>, for example, Daubechies discusses
aspects of this matter at length and exposes, in particular, works
of Cohen and Lawton which give necessary and sufficient conditions
<!--  %**** String Line 825 **** -->for a unit vector <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{1}" text="m _ 1" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to be a <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">trigonometric polynomial</text>
and generate a wavelet. The point to keep in mind, for our purposes,
is that a unit vector <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{1}\in\mathcal{X}" text="m _ 1 element-of X" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> always generates an isometry <Math mode="inline" tex="S_{1}" text="S _ 1" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Further, the minimal unitary extension of <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi(S_{1})" text="pi * S _ 1" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m6.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m6.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, lives on the space
<Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\mathbb{T}_{\infty},\tilde{\mu})" text="L ^ 2 * open-interval@(T _ infinity, tilde@(mu))" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m8.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m8.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m8.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m8.1">
                      <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{\mu}" text="tilde@(mu)" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is constructed
using <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{1}" text="m _ 1" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. These things do not depend on anything other than the fact that
<Math mode="inline" tex="m_{1}" text="m _ 1" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a unit vector in <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{X}" text="X" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
However, <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">some</text> hypotheses on <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{1}" text="m _ 1" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> seem to be necessary to get
from <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\mathbb{T}_{\infty},\tilde{\mu})" text="L ^ 2 * open-interval@(T _ infinity, tilde@(mu))" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m14">

            </XMath>

Conclusion 1. of Mallat’s theorem is the stepping stone that takes us
from <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\mathbb{T}_{\infty},\tilde{\mu})" text="L ^ 2 * open-interval@(T _ infinity, tilde@(mu))" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>

                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>

                    <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m16.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m16.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m16.1">
                      <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\mathbb{R})" text="L ^ 2 * R" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>

                  <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m17.1"/>

                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Conclusion 2. does not play an immediate role in the Larsen-Raeburn
approach, but it implies, in particular, that translates of <Math mode="inline" tex="\hat{\phi}" text="hat@(phi)" xml:id="S6.Thmthm2.p1.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="hat" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">^</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
are orthonormal <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="sM89" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Equation (50)]</cite>.</p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S6.p4">
      <p>With the aid of <Math mode="inline" tex="\phi" text="phi" xml:id="S6.p4.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> we may define <Math mode="inline" tex="R_{n}:H_{n}\rightarrow L^{2}(\mathbb{R})" text="R _ n colon H _ n rightarrow L ^ 2 * R" xml:id="S6.p4.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="rightarrow" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p4.m2.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p4.m2.1">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
via the formula <Math mode="inline" tex="(R_{n}\xi)(x):=2^{\frac{-n}{2}}\xi(e^{2\pi i(2^{-n}x)})\phi(2^{-n}x)" text="R _ n * xi * x assign 2 ^ ((- n) / 2) * xi * e ^ (2 * pi * i * 2 ^ (- n) * x) * phi * 2 ^ (- n) * x" xml:id="S6.p4.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>

                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p4.m3.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p4.m3.2">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="script" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p4.m3.4"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p4.m3.4">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.p4.m3.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S6.p4.m3.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>

                                </XMApp>

                            </XMApp>

                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p4.m3.5"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p4.m3.5">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,
<Math mode="inline" tex="\xi\in H_{n}(=L^{2}(\mathbb{T}))" text="xi element-of annotated@(H _ n, absent = L ^ 2 * T)" xml:id="S6.p4.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="annotated"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p4.m4.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p4.m4.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.p4.m4.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p4.m4.1">T</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. It then is a simple matter to
check that <Math mode="inline" tex="R_{n}" text="R _ n" xml:id="S6.p4.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is an isometry that satisfies the equation
<Math mode="inline" tex="R_{n+1}\pi(S_{1})=R_{n}" text="R _ (n + 1) * pi * S _ 1 = R _ n" xml:id="S6.p4.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p4.m6.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p4.m6.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
By properties of inductive limits, we may conclude that there is a
unique Hilbert space isometric injection <Math mode="inline" tex="R_{\infty}:H_{\infty}\rightarrow L^{2}(\mathbb{R})" text="R _ infinity colon H _ infinity rightarrow L ^ 2 * R" xml:id="S6.p4.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="rightarrow" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p4.m7.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p4.m7.1">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
<!--  %**** String Line 850 **** -->so that <Math mode="inline" tex="R_{\infty}S_{\infty,n}=R_{n}" text="R _ infinity * S _ (list@(infinity, n)) = R _ n" xml:id="S6.p4.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p4.m8.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p4.m8.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID" xml:id="S6.p4.m8.1">∞</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p4.m8.2">n</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The problem now is to show
that <Math mode="inline" tex="R_{\infty}" text="R _ infinity" xml:id="S6.p4.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is surjective. For this purpose, define
<Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{V}_{n}:=R_{n}H_{n}=R_{n}L^{2}(\mathbb{T})." text="V _ n assign R _ n * H _ n = R _ n * L ^ 2 * T" xml:id="S6.p4.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S6.p4.m10.2"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S6.p4.m10.2">
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p4.m10.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p4.m10.1">T</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
Then, as Mallat showed in the proof of the second half of Theorem
2 in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="sM89" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, we have:</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_lem" inlist="thm theorem:lem" labels="LABEL:Mallat" xml:id="S6.Thmthm3">
      <tags>
        <tag>Lemma 6.3</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">6.3</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Lemma 6.3</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Lemma 6.3</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S6.Thmthm3.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">(Mallat)</text></p>
        <enumerate xml:id="S6.I3">
          <item xml:id="S6.I3.i1">
            <tags>
              <tag>(1)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item 1</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S6.I3.i1.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{V}_{n}\subseteq\mathcal{V}_{n+1}" text="V _ n subset-of-or-equals V _ (n + 1)" xml:id="S6.I3.i1.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="subset-of-or-equals" name="subseteq" role="RELOP">⊆</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic">.</text></p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S6.I3.i2">
            <tags>
              <tag>(2)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item 2</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S6.I3.i2.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\cap{\mathcal{V}_{n}}=\{0\}" text="intersection V _ n = set@(0)" xml:id="S6.I3.i2.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                          <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.I3.i2.p1.m1.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S6.I3.i2.p1.m1.1">0</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic">.</text></p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S6.I3.i3">
            <tags>
              <tag>(3)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">3</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item 3</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S6.I3.i3.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\bigvee\mathcal{V}_{n}=L^{2}(\mathbb{R})" text="or@(V _ n) = L ^ 2 * R" xml:id="S6.I3.i3.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="or" name="bigvee" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⋁</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                          <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.I3.i3.p1.m1.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.I3.i3.p1.m1.1">R</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic">.</text></p>
            </para>
          </item>
        </enumerate>
        <p><text font="italic">Thus <Math mode="inline" tex="R_{\infty}:H_{\infty}\rightarrow L^{2}(\mathbb{R})" text="R _ infinity colon H _ infinity rightarrow L ^ 2 * R" xml:id="S6.Thmthm3.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="rightarrow" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm3.p1.m1.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Thmthm3.p1.m1.1">R</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a Hilbert
space isomorphism.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S6.p5">
      <p>We want to remark that conditions 2. and 3. of the preceding lemma
represent two different problems. Condition 2. is the assertion that
the isometry <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi(S_{1})" text="pi * S _ 1" xml:id="S6.p5.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p5.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p5.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a pure isometry. Bratteli and Jorgensen
provide a proof of this that is different from Mallat’s by noting
that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi(S_{1})" text="pi * S _ 1" xml:id="S6.p5.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p5.m2.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p5.m2.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is pure because <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{1}" text="m _ 1" xml:id="S6.p5.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> does not have modulus
one a.e. <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BJ97" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 3.1]</cite>. The condition 3. also has alternate
proofs. One that we find particularly attractive, because it works
in the more general setting of wavelets built on <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbb{T}^{n}" text="T ^ n" xml:id="S6.p5.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
using a dilation matrix <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S6.p5.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, may be found in Strichartz’s survey
<!--  %**** String Line 875 **** --><cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="rS94" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Lemma 3.1]</cite>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S6.p6">
      <p>Recall that the “dilation by <Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S6.p6.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> operator”, <Math mode="inline" tex="D" text="D" xml:id="S6.p6.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, is defined on
<Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\mathbb{R})" text="L ^ 2 * R" xml:id="S6.p6.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p6.m3.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p6.m3.1">R</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> by the formula <Math mode="inline" tex="D\xi(x)=2^{1/2}\xi(2x)" text="D * xi * x = 2 ^ (1 / 2) * xi * 2 * x" xml:id="S6.p6.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p6.m4.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p6.m4.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p6.m4.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p6.m4.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and
that <Math mode="inline" tex="D" text="D" xml:id="S6.p6.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> a unitary operator on <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\mathbb{R})" text="L ^ 2 * R" xml:id="S6.p6.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p6.m6.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p6.m6.1">R</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_lem" inlist="thm theorem:lem" xml:id="S6.Thmthm4">
      <tags>
        <tag>Lemma 6.4</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">6.4</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Lemma 6.4</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Lemma 6.4</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S6.Thmthm4.p1">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="R_{\infty}UR_{\infty}^{-1}=D," text="R _ infinity * U * (R _ infinity) ^ (- 1) = D" xml:id="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m1.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic"> and
<Math mode="inline" tex="R_{\infty}\rho(f)R_{\infty}^{-1}\xi(t)=f(e^{2\pi it})\xi(t)" text="R _ infinity * rho * f * (R _ infinity) ^ (- 1) * xi * t = f * e ^ (2 * pi * i * t) * xi * t" xml:id="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m2.1">f</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m2.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m2.2">t</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m2.4"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m2.4">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">t</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m2.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m2.3">t</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
for all <Math mode="inline" tex="f\in C(\mathbb{T})," text="f element-of C * T" xml:id="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m3.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m3.2">
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m3.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m3.1">T</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> all <Math mode="inline" tex="\xi" text="xi" xml:id="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\mathbb{R})" text="L ^ 2 * R" xml:id="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m5.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m5.1">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
and all <Math mode="inline" tex="t\in\mathbb{R}" text="t element-of R" xml:id="S6.Thmthm4.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">t</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard upright" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S6.p7">
        <p>The first assertion requires only a simple calculation:</p>
        <equation>
          <Math mode="display" tex="\displaystyle D(R_{\infty}(S_{\infty,n+1}\xi))(x)=D(R_{n+1}\xi)(x)=2^{1/2}(R_{%&#10;n+1}\xi)(2x)\\&#10;\displaystyle=2^{1/2}2^{\frac{-(n+1)}{2}}\xi(e^{2\pi i(2^{-(n+1)}2x)})\phi(2^{%&#10;-(n+1)}2x)=(R_{n}\xi)(x)\\&#10;\displaystyle=(R_{\infty}S_{\infty,n}\xi)(x)=(R_{\infty}US_{\infty,n+1}\xi)(x)." text="D * R _ infinity * S _ (list@(infinity, n + 1)) * xi * x = D * R _ (n + 1) * xi * x = 2 ^ (1 / 2) * R _ (n + 1) * xi * 2 * x = 2 ^ (1 / 2) * 2 ^ ((- (n + 1)) / 2) * xi * e ^ (2 * pi * i * 2 ^ (- (n + 1)) * 2 * x) * phi * 2 ^ (- (n + 1)) * 2 * x = R _ n * xi * x = R _ infinity * S _ (list@(infinity, n)) * xi * x = R _ infinity * U * S _ (list@(infinity, n + 1)) * xi * x" xml:id="S6.p7.m1">
            <XMath>

                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>

                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>

                                </XMApp>

        <p>The second assertion is verified similarly.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <para class="ltx_noindent" xml:id="S6.p8">
      <p>If we set <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{W}_{n}=\mathcal{V}_{n+1}\ominus\mathcal{V}_{n}" text="W _ n = V _ (n + 1) symmetric-difference V _ n" xml:id="S6.p8.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="symmetric-difference" name="ominus" role="ADDOP">⊖</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,
then by Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:Mallat"/>:</p>
      <equation xml:id="S6.Ex31">
        <Math mode="display" tex="\bigoplus_{n\in\mathbb{Z}}\mathcal{W}_{n}=L^{2}(\mathbb{R})." text="(direct-sum _ (n element-of Z))@(W _ n) = L ^ 2 * R" xml:id="S6.Ex31.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex31.m1.2"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex31.m1.2">
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                      <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="display" meaning="direct-sum" name="bigoplus" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">⊕</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="blackboard" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex31.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex31.m1.1">R</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>But then we find that
<!--  %**** String Line 900 **** --></p>
    </para>
    <para class="ltx_noindent" xml:id="S6.p9">
      <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_eqnarray" xml:id="A0.EGx5">
        <equation labels="LABEL:eq:Wzero" xml:id="S6.Ex34">
          <MathFork>
            <Math tex="\displaystyle\mathcal{W}_{0}=\mathcal{V}_{1}\ominus\mathcal{V}_{0}=R_{1}L^{2}(%&#10;\mathbb{T})\ominus R_{0}L^{2}(\mathbb{T})=R_{1}L^{2}(\mathbb{T})\ominus R_{1}%&#10;\pi(S_{1})L^{2}(\mathbb{T})=R_{1}(L^{2}(\mathbb{T})\ominus\pi(S_{1})L^{2}(%&#10;\mathbb{T}))=R_{1}\pi(S_{2})L^{2}(\mathbb{T})," text="W _ 0 = V _ 1 symmetric-difference V _ 0 = R _ 1 * L ^ 2 * T symmetric-difference R _ 0 * L ^ 2 * T = R _ 1 * L ^ 2 * T symmetric-difference R _ 1 * pi * S _ 1 * L ^ 2 * T = R _ 1 * (L ^ 2 * T symmetric-difference pi * S _ 1 * L ^ 2 * T) = R _ 1 * pi * S _ 2 * L ^ 2 * T" xml:id="S6.Ex34.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.Ex34.m4.8"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex34.m4.8">
                      <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post8"/>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="symmetric-difference" name="ominus" role="ADDOP">⊖</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post8"/>
                          <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post8"/>
                          <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>

                              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex34.m3.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex34.m3.1">T</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math></td>
              </tr>
            </MathBranch>
          </MathFork>
        </equation>
      </equationgroup>
      <p>by the Cuntz relations. So if we set <Math mode="inline" tex="e_{k}(z)=z^{k}" text="e _ k * z = z ^ k" xml:id="S6.p9.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p9.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p9.m1.1">z</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and set
<Math mode="inline" tex="\zeta_{k}:=R_{1}\pi(S_{2})e_{-k}" text="zeta _ k assign R _ 1 * pi * S _ 2 * e _ (- k)" xml:id="S6.p9.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p9.m2.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p9.m2.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
Then <Math mode="inline" tex="\{\zeta_{k}\}" text="set@(zeta _ k)" xml:id="S6.p9.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>

                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S6.p9.m3.1">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is an orthonormal basis for <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{W}_{0}" text="W _ 0" xml:id="S6.p9.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

      <p>where</p>
      <equation xml:id="S6.Ex37">
        <Math mode="display" tex="\zeta(x):=m_{2}(e^{\pi ix})\phi(2^{-1}x)." text="zeta * x assign m _ 2 * e ^ (pi * i * x) * phi * 2 ^ (- 1) * x" xml:id="S6.Ex37.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex37.m1.2"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex37.m1.2">
                  <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex37.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex37.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex37.m1.2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex37.m1.2.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex37.m1.2.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex37.m1.2.2">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
    </para>
    <para class="ltx_noindent" xml:id="S6.p10">
      <p>Thus, <Math mode="inline" tex="\{\zeta_{j,k}\}_{j,k=-\infty}^{\infty}" text="((set@(zeta _ (list@(j, k)))) _ (list@(j, k) = - infinity)) ^ infinity" xml:id="S6.p10.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p10.m1.5"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p10.m1.5">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.p10.m1.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.p10.m1.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p10.m1.1">j</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p10.m1.2">k</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p10.m1.3"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p10.m1.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p10.m1.3">j</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p10.m1.4">k</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is an orthonormal
basis for <Math mode="inline" tex="L^{2}(\mathbb{R})" text="L ^ 2 * R" xml:id="S6.p10.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p10.m2.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p10.m2.1">R</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, where</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S6.p11">
      <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_eqnarray" xml:id="A0.EGx7">
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex39">
          <MathFork>

              <tr>
                <td align="right"><Math mode="inline" tex="\displaystyle\zeta_{j,k}(x)" text="zeta _ (list@(j, k)) * x" xml:id="S6.Ex38.m1">

                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math></td>
                <td align="left"><Math mode="inline" tex="\displaystyle D^{j}\zeta_{k}(x)" text="D ^ j * zeta _ k * x" xml:id="S6.Ex38.m3">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post8"/>

                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post8"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.Ex38.m3.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
