                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math></td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td align="right"/>
                <td align="center"><Math mode="inline" tex="\displaystyle=" text="=" xml:id="S6.Ex39.m2">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math></td>
                <td align="left"><Math mode="inline" tex="\displaystyle 2^{j/2}e^{(-2\pi ik2^{j}x)}\zeta(2^{j}x)." text="2 ^ (j / 2) * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * k * 2 ^ j * x) * zeta * 2 ^ j * x" xml:id="S6.Ex39.m3">
                    <XMath>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.Ex39.m3.2"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex39.m3.2">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post8"/>
                              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post8"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="S6.Ex39.m3.1"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex39.m3.1">
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                                      <XMApp>
                                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                                      </XMApp>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex39.m3.2.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex39.m3.2.1">
                                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post8"/>
                                    <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMath>
                  </Math></td>
              </tr>
            </MathBranch>
          </MathFork>
        </equation>
      </equationgroup>
    </para>
    <para class="ltx_noindent" xml:id="S6.p12">
      <p>Consequently, if <Math mode="inline" tex="\psi" text="psi" xml:id="S6.p12.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the inverse Fourier transform
of <Math mode="inline" tex="\zeta" text="zeta" xml:id="S6.p12.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, then <Math mode="inline" tex="\psi" text="psi" xml:id="S6.p12.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a wavelet.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S6.p13">
      <p>This completes the proof of the following theorem as formulated by
Bratteli and Jorgensen <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="BJ97" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> and Larsen and Raeburn <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="LR06" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:JLR" xml:id="S6.Thmthm5">
      <tags>
        <tag>Theorem 6.5</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">6.5</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 6.5</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 6.5</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S6.Thmthm5.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">(Bratteli-Jorgensen, Larsen-Raeburn)</text></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.Thmthm5.p2">
        <p><text font="italic">The inverse Fourier transform of</text></p>
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex40">
          <Math mode="display" tex="m_{2}(e^{\pi ix})\phi(2^{-1}x)" text="m _ 2 * e ^ (pi * i * x) * phi * 2 ^ (- 1) * x" xml:id="S6.Ex40.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.Ex40.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex40.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="phi" role="UNKNOWN">ϕ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.Ex40.m1.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex40.m1.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p><text font="italic">is the wavelet associated with the filter bank <Math mode="inline" tex="(m_{1},m_{2})" text="open-interval@(m _ 1, m _ 2)" xml:id="S6.Thmthm5.p2.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm5.p2.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.Thmthm5.p2.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.Thmthm5.p2.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.Thmthm5.p2.m1.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" xml:id="S7">
    <tags>
      <tag>7</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">7</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§7</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">7</tag>Further Thoughts: Fractafolds</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">7</tag>Further Thoughts: Fractafolds</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S7.p1">
      <p>As we have seen, the <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S7.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebra <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S7.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m2.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p1.m2.1">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> always contains
an isometry <Math mode="inline" tex="S" text="S" xml:id="S7.p1.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and a Cuntz family of isometries <Math mode="inline" tex="\{S_{i}\}_{i=1}^{n}" text="((set@(S _ i)) _ (i = 1)) ^ n" xml:id="S7.p1.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m4.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.p1.m4.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,
provided <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{X}" text="X" xml:id="S7.p1.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> has an orthonormal basis. Further, we may
construct the minimal unitary extension of either <Math mode="inline" tex="S" text="S" xml:id="S7.p1.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> or of any of
the <Math mode="inline" tex="S_{i}" text="S _ i" xml:id="S7.p1.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">essentially within</text> <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S7.p1.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m8.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p1.m8.1">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. More accurately,
these objects are constructed in the multiplier algebra of the <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S7.p1.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebra
<!--  %**** String Line 950 **** -->of a Morita equivalent groupoid that we denote by <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\infty}" text="G _ infinity" xml:id="S7.p1.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. To
construct <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\infty}," text="G _ infinity" xml:id="S7.p1.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m11.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S7.p1.m11.1">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> we form an analogue of the <Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S7.p1.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-adic solenoid,
viz., the projective limit space
<Math mode="inline" tex="X_{\infty}:=\{\underline{x}:=(x_{1},x_{2},\ldots)\,:\,T(x_{k+1})=x_{k}\}" text="X _ infinity assign conditional-set@(underline@(x) assign vector@(x _ 1, x _ 2, ldots), T * x _ (k + 1) = x _ k)" xml:id="S7.p1.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="conditional-set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m13.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m13.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.p1.m13.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="underline" role="UNDERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m13.2.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m13.2.2"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m13.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.p1.m13.2.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.p1.m13.2.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="ldots" role="ID" xml:id="S7.p1.m13.1">…</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" rpadding="1.7pt" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP" rpadding="1.7pt">:</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.p1.m13.3">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m13.3.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S7.p1.m13.3.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,
and we set</p>
      <equation xml:id="S7.Ex41">
        <Math mode="display" tex="G_{\infty}=\{(\underline{x},n-m,\underline{y})\,:\,T^{n}x_{1}=T^{m}y_{1}\}." text="G _ infinity = conditional-set@(vector@(underline@(x), n - m, underline@(y)), T ^ n * x _ 1 = T ^ m * y _ 1)" xml:id="S7.Ex41.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S7.Ex41.m1.3"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex41.m1.3">
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="conditional-set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Ex41.m1.3.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Ex41.m1.3.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S7.Ex41.m1.3.1">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.Ex41.m1.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.Ex41.m1.3.1.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.Ex41.m1.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex41.m1.1">
                            <XMTok name="underline" role="UNDERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex41.m1.3.1.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex41.m1.2">
                            <XMTok name="underline" role="UNDERACCENT">¯</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" rpadding="1.7pt" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP" rpadding="1.7pt">:</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex41.m1.3.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>Then <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\infty}" text="G _ infinity" xml:id="S7.p1.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a groupoid with unit space <Math mode="inline" tex="X_{\infty}" text="X _ infinity" xml:id="S7.p1.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> that
is Morita equivalent to <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.p1.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in the sense of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="MRW87" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. Note,
however, that <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\infty}" text="G _ infinity" xml:id="S7.p1.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is not <Math mode="inline" tex="r" text="r" xml:id="S7.p1.m18">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-discrete. It has many Haar
systems that are not in any evident way equivalent. Each transfer
operator <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{L}_{D}^{*}" text="(L _ D) ^ *" xml:id="S7.p1.m19">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> associated with a continuous function
<Math mode="inline" tex="D" text="D" xml:id="S7.p1.m20">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> as in equation (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:Transfer"/>) determines a natural Haar
system on <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\infty}" text="G _ infinity" xml:id="S7.p1.m21">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> that reflects special features of <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S7.p1.m22">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m22.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p1.m22.1">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
In particular, if <Math mode="inline" tex="D=|m|" text="D = absolute-value@(m)" xml:id="S7.p1.m23">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m23.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p1.m23.1">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> where <Math mode="inline" tex="m" text="m" xml:id="S7.p1.m24">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a unit vector in
<Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{X}" text="X" xml:id="S7.p1.m25">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> (so in particular if <Math mode="inline" tex="m" text="m" xml:id="S7.p1.m26">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is part of an orthonormal
basis for <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{X}" text="X" xml:id="S7.p1.m27">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>), then the minimal unitary extension of
<Math mode="inline" tex="S_{1}=\iota(m)S" text="S _ 1 = iota * m * S" xml:id="S7.p1.m28">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="iota" role="UNKNOWN">ι</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m28.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p1.m28.1">m</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
(in the notation of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:DeaconuIsoThm"/>) lives in the multiplier
algebra of <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G_{\infty})" text="C ^ * * G _ infinity" xml:id="S7.p1.m29">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m29.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.p1.m29.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, when <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\infty}" text="G _ infinity" xml:id="S7.p1.m30">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is endowed with
the Haar system determined by <Math mode="inline" tex="|m|" text="absolute-value@(m)" xml:id="S7.p1.m31">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m31.1"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p1.m31.1">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S7.p2">
      <p>We observe in passing that Dutkay and Jorgensen <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="DJ06" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> associate
the <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S7.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-crossed product <Math mode="inline" tex="C(X_{\infty})\rtimes\mathbb{Z}" text="(C * X _ infinity) right-normal-factor-semidirect-product Z" xml:id="S7.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="right-normal-factor-semidirect-product" name="rtimes" role="MULOP">⋊</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p2.m2.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.p2.m2.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> to
the setting we have been discussing (where <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbb{Z}" text="Z" xml:id="S7.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is viewed
as acting on <Math mode="inline" tex="X_{\infty}" text="X _ infinity" xml:id="S7.p2.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> through the homeomorphism <Math mode="inline" tex="T_{\infty}" text="T _ infinity" xml:id="S7.p2.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,
<!--  %**** String Line 975 **** -->which is defined via the formula
<Math mode="inline" tex="T_{\infty}(x_{1},x_{2},\ldots)=(Tx_{1},x_{1},x_{2},\ldots)" text="T _ infinity * vector@(x _ 1, x _ 2, ldots) = vector@(T * x _ 1, x _ 1, x _ 2, ldots)" xml:id="S7.p2.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>

                  <XMApp>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.p2.m6.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.p2.m6.4">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="vector"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p2.m6.5"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p2.m6.6"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p2.m6.7"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p2.m6.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.p2.m6.5">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.p2.m6.6">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.p2.m6.7">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="ldots" role="ID" xml:id="S7.p2.m6.2">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.)
This crossed product lies in the multiplier algebra of <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G_{\infty})" text="C ^ * * G _ infinity" xml:id="S7.p2.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p2.m7.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.p2.m7.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S7.p3">
      <p>Thus, our analysis shows that the study of wavelets can be broken
into two pieces. First, there are the structures that are intrinsic
to the geometric setting of a space <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S7.p3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with a local homeomorphism
<Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S7.p3.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. These include the groupoid <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.p3.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and its <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S7.p3.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebra, the
pseudogroup <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathfrak{G}" text="G" xml:id="S7.p3.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="fraktur" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and the Deaconu correspondence <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{X}" text="X" xml:id="S7.p3.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
These are the source of isometries and the Cuntz relations - assuming
<Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{X}" text="X" xml:id="S7.p3.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> has an orthonormal basis. Each choice of orthonormal
basis gives Cuntz isometries in <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S7.p3.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p3.m8.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p3.m8.1">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> that satisfy equation
(<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:inner"/>). Even if <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{X}" text="X" xml:id="S7.p3.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> fails to have an orthonormal
basis, <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{X}" text="X" xml:id="S7.p3.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> will always contain a (<text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">normalized tight</text>)
<text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">frame</text> in the sense of Frank and Larson <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="FL99" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Definition 3.1]</cite>
(also called a <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">quasi-basis</text> in the sense of Watatani <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="yW90" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>).
This is a collection of vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="\{\psi_{i}\}_{i=1}^{n}" text="((set@(psi _ i)) _ (i = 1)) ^ n" xml:id="S7.p3.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.p3.m11.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.p3.m11.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> such that
for every <Math mode="inline" tex="\xi\in\mathcal{X}," text="xi element-of X" xml:id="S7.p3.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S7.p3.m12.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S7.p3.m12.1">
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
<Math mode="inline" tex="\xi=\sum_{i=1}^{n}\psi_{i}\langle\psi_{i},\xi\rangle" text="xi = ((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@(psi _ i * list@(psi _ i, xi))" xml:id="S7.p3.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.p3.m13.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.p3.m13.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.p3.m13.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p3.m13.1">ξ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>and
<Math mode="inline" tex="\langle\xi,\xi\rangle=\sum_{i=1}^{n}\langle\xi,\psi_{i}\rangle\langle\psi_{i},\xi\rangle" text="list@(xi, xi) = ((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@(list@(xi, psi _ i) * list@(psi _ i, xi))" xml:id="S7.p3.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p3.m14.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p3.m14.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p3.m14.1">ξ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p3.m14.2">ξ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.p3.m14.3"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.p3.m14.5"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p3.m14.3">ξ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.p3.m14.5">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.p3.m14.6"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.p3.m14.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.p3.m14.6">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p3.m14.4">ξ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
Such a collection may be constructed easily with the aid of a partition
of unity subordinate to an open cover of <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S7.p3.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S7.p3.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a
homeomorphism when restricted to each element of the cover. Much of
the analysis in <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}(G)" text="C ^ * * G" xml:id="S7.p3.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.p3.m17.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> can be accomplished with a frame for <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{X}" text="X" xml:id="S7.p3.m18">

        </Math>.

    <para xml:id="S7.p4">

<!--  %**** String Line 1025 **** -->    <para xml:id="S7.p5">
      <p>We believe the proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:JLR"/> that we presented, which
is due to Larsen and Raeburn <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="LR06" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, can be tweaked to show
a bit more. The <Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S7.p5.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-adic solenoid <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbb{T}_{\infty}" text="T _ infinity" xml:id="S7.p5.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the dual
group of the <Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S7.p5.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-adic numbers: the set of all rational numbers whose
denominators are powers of <Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S7.p5.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, positive and negative. Since the
<Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S7.p5.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-adic numbers form a dense subgroup of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbb{R}" text="R" xml:id="S7.p5.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbb{T}_{\infty}" text="T _ infinity" xml:id="S7.p5.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
contains a dense copy of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbb{R}" text="R" xml:id="S7.p5.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. We believe the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{\mu}" text="tilde@(mu)" xml:id="S7.p5.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
is supported on this copy of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbb{R}" text="R" xml:id="S7.p5.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="blackboard" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and is mutually absolutely
continuous with respect to Lebesgue measure transported there. The
mapping <Math mode="inline" tex="R_{\infty}" text="R _ infinity" xml:id="S7.p5.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> ought to be, then, just multiplication by (the
square root of) a suitable Radon-Nikodym derivative.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S7.p6">
      <p>In another direction, which we find very piquant, we can find Cuntz
families in the <Math mode="inline" tex="C^{*}" text="C ^ *" xml:id="S7.p6.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-algebras or their multiplier algebras of
other groupoids that are Morita equivalent to <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.p6.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. This raises the
prospect of carrying out groupoid-like harmonic analysis using Cuntz
families of isometries on other spaces that Strichartz has called
<text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">fractafolds</text> - i.e. spaces that are locally like fractals <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="rS03" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.
The point is that under favorable circumstances <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S7.p6.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the groupoid
of germs of the pseudogroup <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathfrak{G}" text="G" xml:id="S7.p6.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="fraktur" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of partial homeomorphisms
defined by <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S7.p6.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. We believe the pseudogroup of partial homeomorphisms
of a fractafold that is locally like <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S7.p6.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> will be Morita equivalent,
in a sense described by Renault in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="jR00" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Section 3]</cite>, to <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathfrak{G}" text="G" xml:id="S7.p6.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="fraktur" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
This sense is based on work of Kumjian <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="aK84" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> and Haefliger
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="aH85" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. At this stage, however, there still is a lot of work
<!--  %**** String Line 1050 **** -->to do to substantiate this belief.</p>
    </para>
  </section>
